item.title: MIT 18.06(Linear Algebra) L2 Note
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. Mind Map 2. Reading Notes(2.2-2.3) 2.2 The Idea of Elimination A systematic way to solve linear equations: elimination GOAL: produce an upper triangular system The system solved from the bottom upwards: back substitution Pivot : first nonzero in the row that does the elimination Multiplier : (entry to eliminate) divided by (pivot) Breakdown of Elimination Failure: The method might ask us to divide by zero. Permanent failure with no solution.
